DisplayString.Name: MSSQL on Windows Integration Services: Local Instance
DisplayString.Description: An installation of a Local MSSQL Interation Services on Windows.

DisplayString.Name: Machine Name
Type
Service Name
Monitoring Type
Principal Name

Major version
Netbios computer name
MSSQL on Windows Integration Services: Local Seed
DisplayString.Description: It is a seed for MSSQL Integration Services on Windows installation. This object indicates that the particular server computer contains MSSQL Integration Services on Windows installation.

DisplayString.Name: MSSQL on Windows Integration Services: Local Integration Service Instance Probe Discovery on Windows
DisplayString.Description: Local Integration Service Instance Probe Discovery on Windows

DisplayString.Name: MSSQL on Windows Integration Services: Discover Local SQL Server Integration Services
DisplayString.Description: This rule discovers Local SQL Server Integration Services on Windows.

DisplayString.Name: MSSQL on Windows Integration Services: Discover Installation Source (seed)
DisplayString.Description: This rule discovers a seed for MSSQL Integration Services on Windows installation. This object indicates that the particular server computer contains MSSQL Integration Services on Windows installation.

DisplayString.Name: MSSQL on Windows Integration Services: Local SQL Server Integration Services Discovery Source
DisplayString.Description: This module type is used to discover instances of Local MSSQL Integration Services. The module queries the registry and WMI for installation information.

DisplayString.Name: Interval (seconds)
DisplayString.Description: The recurring interval of time in seconds in which to run the workflow.

DisplayString.Name: Synchronization Time
DisplayString.Description: The synchronization time specified by using a 24-hour format. May be omitted.

DisplayString.Name: Timeout (seconds)
DisplayString.Description: Specifies the time the workflow is allowed to run before being closed and marked as failed.

DisplayString.Name: Mixed Monitoring
DisplayString.Description: Specifies the names of the instances that should be monitored in mixed mode. Use comma to divide instance names. Cluster instances are always monitored in mixed mode. Use "*" to monitor all local Integration Services in mixed mode.

DisplayString.Name: MSSQL on Windows Integration Services: Data Source for Discover Installation Source (seed)
DisplayString.Description: SSIS Data Source for an installation seed for a SSIS Discovery.

DisplayString.Name: Interval (seconds)
DisplayString.Description: The recurring interval of time in seconds in which to run the workflow.

DisplayString.Name: Synchronization Time
DisplayString.Description: The synchronization time specified by using a 24-hour format. May be omitted.

DisplayString.Name: Timeout (seconds)
DisplayString.Description: Specifies the time the workflow is allowed to run before being closed and marked as failed.

DisplayString.Name: Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services on Windows
DisplayString.Description: This Management Pack discovers and monitors Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services and related objects on Windows.

DisplayString.Name: MSSQL on Windows Integration Services: Integration Service Status Probe Action
DisplayString.Description: Integration Service Status Action on Windows

DisplayString.Name: MSSQL on Windows Integration Services: Instance Status Provider
DisplayString.Description: SQL Integration Services Instance Status Provider on Windows

DisplayString.Name: Interval (seconds)
DisplayString.Description: The recurring interval of time in seconds in which to run the workflow.

DisplayString.Name: Synchronization Time
DisplayString.Description: The synchronization time specified by using a 24-hour format. May be omitted.

DisplayString.Name: Alert only if service startup type is automatic
DisplayString.Description: This may only be set to 'true' or 'false'. The workflow will not consider the current startup type setting of the service if this parameter is set to 'false'. Default is 'true'.

DisplayString.Name: Unavailable Time (seconds)
DisplayString.Description: The minimum duration of service unavailability before considering it unhealthy.

DisplayString.Name: Integration Service Health Status
DisplayString.Description: This monitor checks the health state of the "SQL Server Integration Services" Windows service.

DisplayString.Name: Online
DisplayString.Description: Integration Service instance is available

DisplayString.Name: Unavailable
DisplayString.Description: Integration Service instance is unavailable

DisplayString.Name: MSSQL on Windows Integration Services: Integration Service is in unhealthy state
DisplayString.Description: Integration Service "{0}" has stopped on computer "{1}".

DisplayString.Name: MSSQL on Windows Integration Services: Integration Service Status Provider
DisplayString.Description: Monitor type for detect state of SQL Server Integration Services windows service on Windows.

DisplayString.Name: Alert only if service startup type is automatic
DisplayString.Description: This may only be set to 'true' or 'false'. The workflow will not consider the current startup type setting of the service if this parameter is set to 'false'. Default is 'true'.

DisplayString.Name: Interval (seconds)
DisplayString.Description: The recurring interval of time in seconds in which to run the workflow.

DisplayString.Name: Synchronization Time
DisplayString.Description: The synchronization time specified by using a 24-hour format. May be omitted.

DisplayString.Name: Unavailable Time (seconds)
DisplayString.Description: The minimum duration of service unavailability before considering it unhealthy.

DisplayString.Name: Timeout (seconds)
DisplayString.Description: Specifies the time the workflow is allowed to run before being closed and marked as failed.

DisplayString.Name: Allow Proxying
DisplayString.Description: Specifies whether the module should collect events that do not originate from the computer that is specified in the ComputerName parameter.

DisplayString.Name: MSSQL Integration Services on Windows: Integration Service Package Failed
DisplayString.Description: A package failed during execution.

DisplayString.Name: MSSQL Integration Services on Windows: Integration Service Package Failed
DisplayString.Description: Event ID: {0}. Package "{1}" failed.

DisplayString.Name: MSSQL Integration Services on Windows: IS Service failed to load user defined Configuration file
DisplayString.Description: The configuration file for the Integration Services service could not be loaded, when the services was started. By default, this file is named MSDtsSrvr.ini.xml. However, Integration Services can be configured by a registry setting to use any file name and file location.

DisplayString.Name: MSSQL Integration Services on Windows: IS Service failed to load user defined Configuration file
DisplayString.Description: Event ID: {0}. Microsoft SSIS Service configuration file does not exist. Loading with default settings.

DisplayString.Name: MSSQL Integration Services on Windows: IS Service has attempted to stop a running package
DisplayString.Description: The Integration Services service was used to send a request to the Integration Services runtime to stop a running package. Note: This rule is disabled by default. Use overrides to enable it when necessary.

DisplayString.Name: MSSQL Integration Services on Windows: IS Service has attempted to stop a running package
MSSQL Integration Services on Windows: Package execution failed because the checkpoint file cannot be loaded
DisplayString.Description: A package that is configured to use checkpoints and to always use the checkpoint file failed to restart.

DisplayString.Name: MSSQL Integration Services on Windows: Package execution failed because the checkpoint file cannot be loaded
MSSQL Integration Services on Windows: The package restarted from checkpoint file. Package was configured to restart from checkpoint and it did
DisplayString.Description: A package configured to use checkpoints failed and then restarted from the point of failure using the checkpoint file.

DisplayString.Name: MSSQL Integration Services on Windows: The package restarted from checkpoint file. Package was configured to restart from checkpoint and it did
MSSQL Integration Services on Windows: Integration Services Buffers Spooled
DisplayString.Description: The number of buffers currently written to the disk. If the data flow engine runs low on physical memory, buffers not currently used are written to disk and then reloaded when needed. This counter is polled every fifteen minutes.

DisplayString.Name: MSSQL Integration Services on Windows: Integration Services Rows Read
DisplayString.Description: This counter indicates the number of rows that a source produces. The number does not include rows read from reference tables by the Lookup transformation. This counter is polled every fifteen minutes.

DisplayString.Name: MSSQL Integration Services on Windows: Integration Services Rows Written
DisplayString.Description: This counter displays the number of rows offered to a destination. The number does not reflect rows written to the destination data store. This counter is polled every fifteen minutes.

DisplayString.Name: MSSQL on Windows Integration Services: Windows Service Control
DisplayString.Description: MSSQL on Windows Integration Services: Windows Service Control.

DisplayString.Name: Timeout (seconds)
DisplayString.Description: Specifies the time the workflow is allowed to run before being closed and marked as failed.

DisplayString.Name: Start Integration Service
DisplayString.Description: Start Integration Service.

DisplayString.Name: Stop Integration Service
DisplayString.Description: Stop Integration Service.

DisplayString.Name: MSSQL on Windows Integration Services: Server Computer Contains SQL Server Integration Services Installation Seed
DisplayString.Description: Server Computer Contains SQL Server Integration Services Installation Seed

DisplayString.Name: MSSQL on Windows Integration Services: Server Computer Hosts SQL Server Integration Services Local Discovery Seed
DisplayString.Description: Server Computer Hosts SQL Server Integration Services Local Discovery Seed

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: An installation of a Local MSSQL Interation Services on Windows.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: It is a seed for MSSQL Integration Services on Windows installation. This object indicates that the particular server computer contains MSSQL Integration Services on Windows installation.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule discovers Local SQL Server Integration Services on Windows.

maml:entry.maml:para: The recurring interval of time in seconds in which to run the workflow.

Specifies the names of the instances that should be monitored in mixed mode. Use comma to divide instance names. Cluster instances are always monitored in mixed mode. Use "*" to monitor all local Integration Services in mixed mode.
The synchronization time specified by using a 24-hour format. May be omitted.
Specifies the time the workflow is allowed to run before being closed and marked as failed.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule discovers a seed for MSSQL Integration Services on Windows installation. This object indicates that the particular server computer contains MSSQL Integration Services on Windows installation.

maml:entry.maml:para: The recurring interval of time in seconds in which to run the workflow.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This Management Pack discovers and monitors Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services and related objects on Windows.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This monitor checks the health state of the "SQL Server Integration Services" Windows service.

maml:entry.maml:para: Alert only if service startup type is automatic
This may only be set to 'true' or 'false'. If set to 'false', then alerts will be triggered no matter what the startup type is set to. Default is 'true'.
Defines whether the workflow generates an Alert.
The recurring interval of time in seconds in which to run the workflow.
The synchronization time specified by using a 24-hour format. May be omitted.
Specifies the time the workflow is allowed to run before being closed and marked as failed.
The minimum duration of service unavailability before considering it unhealthy.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: A package failed during execution.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: Failure may have occurred for a variety of reasons.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Investigate the logs that were generated by the execution instance of the package. If the package was not configured to implement logging, it is recommended that you add logging.

maml:section.maml:title: External
maml:section.maml:para: For more information, see the Docs Online topics: "Integration Services Log Providers" and "Implementing Logging in Packages".

maml:entry.maml:para: Specifies whether the module should collect events that do not originate from the computer that is specified in the ComputerName parameter.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The configuration file for the Integration Services service could not be loaded, when the services was started. By default, this file is named MSDtsSrvr.ini.xml. However, Integration Services can be configured by a registry setting to use any file name and file location.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: The configuration file could not be loaded because file could not be found or the specified file does not have the expected format. The file may be corrupted or the network share on which the file is located, is not accessible.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Provide either a configuration file in the default location, Microsoft\SQL Server\90\DTBinn, or the location that is indicated in the registry key: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\MSDTS\ServiceConfigFiledefault
Verify that the configuration file is an XML file that adheres to the specified schema.

maml:section.maml:title: External
maml:section.maml:para: For more information about the schema of the configuration file, see the Docs Online topics: "Configuring the Integration Services Service", "Configuring a Windows Firewall for Integration Services Access", and "Managing Integration Services Service".

maml:entry.maml:para: Specifies whether the module should collect events that do not originate from the computer that is specified in the ComputerName parameter.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The Integration Services service was used to send a request to the Integration Services runtime to stop a running package.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: A user clicked the Stop option on a package that was listed in Running Packages folder of SQL Server Management Studio.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: If this request was unexpected, you should investigate by checking the logs that were generated by the execution instance of the package as well as the permissions to possible restrict who can stop package execution.

maml:section.maml:title: External
maml:section.maml:para: For more information, see the Docs Online topics: "Integration Services Log Providers", "Implementing Logging in Packages", and "Integration Services Roles".

maml:entry.maml:para: Specifies whether the module should collect events that do not originate from the computer that is specified in the ComputerName parameter.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: A package that is configured to use checkpoints and to always use the checkpoint file failed to restart.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: The checkpoint file could not be loaded because it could not be found or the specified file does not have the expected format.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: The checkpoint file must be available locally. Locate the checkpoint file and move it to the expected location.
If the checkpoint file is not available, run the package using the Set option to override the configured value of the CheckpointUsage property to use either the value IfExists or Never.

maml:section.maml:title: External
maml:section.maml:para: For more information, see the Docs Online topics: "dtexec Utility", "Setting Package Properties", and "Using Checkpoints in Packages".

maml:entry.maml:para: Specifies whether the module should collect events that do not originate from the computer that is specified in the ComputerName parameter.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: A package configured to use checkpoints failed and then restarted from the point of failure using the checkpoint file.

maml:section.maml:title: Causes
maml:section.maml:para: Failure may have occurred for a variety of reasons. However, because the package implements checkpoints, the package restarted from the point of failure in the package control flow, instead of the beginning of the package.

maml:section.maml:title: Resolutions
maml:section.maml:para: Investigate package failure to confirm whether restarting the package was desirable. Investigate logs to identify the cause of the failure that caused package to be restarted from the checkpoint file.

maml:section.maml:title: External
maml:section.maml:para: For more information, see the Docs Online topics: "Setting Package Properties" and "Using Checkpoints in Packages".

maml:entry.maml:para: Specifies whether the module should collect events that do not originate from the computer that is specified in the ComputerName parameter.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The number of buffers currently written to the disk. If the data flow engine runs low on physical memory, buffers not currently used are written to disk and then reloaded when needed. This counter is polled every fifteen minutes.

maml:section.maml:title: External
maml:section.maml:para: For more information, see the Book Online topic "Monitoring Performance of the Data Flow Engine."

maml:entry.maml:para: The recurring interval of time in seconds in which to run the workflow.

maml:entry.maml:para: The recurring interval of time in seconds in which to run the workflow.
